001package org.krmdemo.techlabs.core.datetime;
002
003import java.time.DayOfWeek;
004import java.time.Instant;
005import java.time.LocalDateTime;
006import java.time.Month;
007import java.time.ZoneOffset;
008import java.time.format.TextStyle;
009import java.util.Locale;
010import java.util.Objects;
011import java.util.function.Supplier;
012
013/**
014 * This class is used to represent the date-time types as a triplet of parts,
015 * which could be displayed in three separate columns with natural chronological order.
016 * This is just a simple wrapper over standard {@link LocalDateTime} from JDK.
017 * <hr/>
018 * For a date-time that could be received from terminal in following way <pre>{@code
019 *     ...> date -u
020 *     Wed Oct 15 06:03:38 UTC 2025}</pre>
021 * the properties of this class will be:
022 * <table>
023 *     <tr><th>method</th><th>value</th></tr>
024 *     <tr><td>{@link #getYearAndMonth()}</td><td>{@code "2025-10"}</td></tr>
025 *     <tr><td>{@link #getDayOfMonthAndWeek()}</td><td>{@code "15 (Wed)"}</td></tr>
026 *     <tr><td>{@link #getHoursMinutes()}</td><td>{@code "06:03"}</td></tr>
027 *     <tr><td>{@link #dumpNoWeek()}</td><td>{@code "2025-10-15 06:03"}</td></tr>
028 *     <tr><td>{@link #dump()}</td><td>{@code "2025-10-15 (Wed) 06:03"}</td></tr>
029 * </table>
030 * <hr/>
031 * As far as <b>{@code git}</b>-repository provides the commit-time in UTC time-zone - this class also represents
032 * all it's parts for UTC time-zone and day of week corresponds to {@link Locale#US}
033 * ({@code Mon}, {@code Tue}, {@code Wed}, {@code Thu}, {@code Fri}, {@code Sat}, {@code Sun}) by default .
034 */
035public class DateTimeTriplet {
036
037    private final LocalDateTime localDateTimeUTC;
038
039    /**
040     * @param epochSeconds the number of seconds from the epoch of {@code 1970-01-01T00:00:00Z}
041     */
042    public DateTimeTriplet(long epochSeconds) {
043        this(epochSeconds, 0);
044    }
045
046    /**
047     * @param epochSeconds the number of seconds from the epoch of {@code 1970-01-01T00:00:00Z}
048     * @param nanoOfSecond the nanosecond within the second, from 0 to 999,999,999
049     */
050    public DateTimeTriplet(long epochSeconds, int nanoOfSecond) {
051        this(LocalDateTime.ofEpochSecond(epochSeconds, nanoOfSecond, ZoneOffset.UTC));
052    }
053
054    /**
055     * @param instant a standard representation of date-time instant in Java as {@link Instant}
056     */
057    public DateTimeTriplet(Instant instant) {
058        this(LocalDateTime.ofInstant(instant, ZoneOffset.UTC));
059    }
060
061    /**
062     * @param localDateTimeUTC a date-time in {@link ZoneOffset#UTC} time-zone as {@link LocalDateTime}
063     */
064    public DateTimeTriplet(LocalDateTime localDateTimeUTC) {
065        this.localDateTimeUTC = Objects.requireNonNull(localDateTimeUTC);
066    }
067
068    /**
069     * This provider could be helpful in unit-tests that allows to avoid an unnecessary mocking
070     */
071    public static Supplier<Instant> NOW_PROVIDER = Instant::now;
072
073    /**
074     * The default format of the day of the week is English USA three letters
075     * (like {@code Mon}, {@code Tue}, {@code Wed}, {@code Thu}, {@code Fri}, {@code Sat}, {@code Sun})
076     */
077    public static Supplier<TextStyle> DAY_OF_WEEK__TEXT_STYLE = () -> TextStyle.SHORT;
078
079    /**
080     * The default names of days of the week correspond to English USA locale ({@link Locale#US})
081     */
082    public static Supplier<Locale> DAY_OF_WEEK__LOCALE = () -> Locale.US;
083
084    /**
085     * @return an instance of {@link DateTimeTriplet} that corresponds to current date-time
086     */
087    public static DateTimeTriplet now() {
088        return new DateTimeTriplet(NOW_PROVIDER.get());
089    }
090
091    /**
092     * @return underlying value of standard {@link LocalDateTime} from JDK
093     */
094    public LocalDateTime getLocalDateTime() {
095        return localDateTimeUTC;
096    }
097
098    /**
099     * @return integer value of year
100     */
101    public int getYear() {
102        return localDateTimeUTC.getYear();
103    }
104
105    /**
106     * @return a value of month as enumeration {@link Month}
107     */
108    public Month getMonth() {
109        return localDateTimeUTC.getMonth();
110    }
111
112    /**
113     * @return <b>the first part</b> of date-time triplet that contains dash-separated
114     *          {@link #getYear() year} and {@link #getMonth() month}
115     */
116    public String getYearAndMonth() {
117        return String.format("%04d-%02d", this.getYear(), this.getMonth().getValue());
118    }
119
120    /**
121     * @return an ordinal number of day within the month (from {@code 1} to {@code 31})
122     */
123    public int getDayOfMoth() {
124        return localDateTimeUTC.getDayOfMonth();
125    }
126
127    /**
128     * @return a day of week as enumartion {@link DayOfWeek}
129     */
130    public DayOfWeek getDayOfWeek() {
131        return localDateTimeUTC.getDayOfWeek();
132    }
133
134    /**
135     * @return <b>the second part</b> of date-time triplet that contains {@link #getDayOfMoth()} the day of month}
136     *          and {@link #getDayOfWeek() the day of week as 3-letters acronym}
137     *          in a format described in the declaration of {@link DateTimeTriplet}
138     */
139    public String getDayOfMonthAndWeek() {
140        String dayOfWeekStr = this.getDayOfWeek().getDisplayName(
141            DAY_OF_WEEK__TEXT_STYLE.get(),
142            DAY_OF_WEEK__LOCALE.get()
143        );
144        return String.format("%02d (%s)", this.getDayOfMoth(), dayOfWeekStr);
145    }
146
147    /**
148     * @return a value of <i>hours</i> in the half-open range {@code [0..24)}
149     */
150    public int getHours() {
151        return localDateTimeUTC.getHour();
152    }
153
154    /**
155     * @return a value of <i>minutes</i> in the half-open range {@code [0..60)}
156     */
157    public int getMinutes() {
158        return localDateTimeUTC.getMinute();
159    }
160
161    /**
162     * @return <b>the third part</b> of date-time triplet that contains colon{@code ':'}-separated
163     *          {@link #getHours() hours} and {@link #getMinutes() minutes}
164     */
165    public String getHoursMinutes() {
166        return String.format("%02d:%02d", this.getHours(), this.getMinutes());
167    }
168
169    /**
170     * @return concatenation of 3 parts: <pre>
171     * {@link #getYearAndMonth() yearAndMonth}{@link #getDayOfMonthAndWeek() '-'dayOfMonthAndWeek}{@link #getHoursMinutes() ' 'hoursMinutes}
172     * </pre>
173     */
174    public String dump() {
175        return String.format("%s-%s %s", getYearAndMonth(), getDayOfMonthAndWeek(), getHoursMinutes());
176    }
177
178    /**
179     * @return the same as {@link #dump()}, but without day of week:<pre>
180     * {@link #getYearAndMonth() yearAndMonth}{@link #getDayOfMoth() '-'dayOfMonth}{@link #getHoursMinutes() ' 'hoursMinutes}
181     * </pre>
182     */
183    public String dumpNoWeek() {
184        return String.format("%s-%02d %s", getYearAndMonth(), getDayOfMoth(), getHoursMinutes());
185    }
186
187    @Override
188    public boolean equals(Object thatObj) {
189        if (thatObj instanceof DateTimeTriplet that) {
190            return this.localDateTimeUTC.equals(that.localDateTimeUTC);
191        } else {
192            return false;
193        }
194    }
195
196    @Override
197    public int hashCode() {
198        return this.localDateTimeUTC.hashCode();
199    }
200
201    @Override
202    public String toString() {
203        return this.dump();
204    }
205}
